message.content:
cs.HC, cs.GR, cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.MM

The paper discusses the design and evaluation of a joint system consisting of an optical see-through head-mounted display (OST HMD) and a body-proximate display, which involves human-computer interaction (HCI) and graphical user interface (GUI) design (cs.HC). The experiment conducted in the paper involves visual search tasks, which can be categorized as a computer vision problem (cs.CV). The paper also discusses the challenges of integrating virtual and real-world information, which can be related to graphics (cs.GR) and robotics (cs.RO). Finally, the paper involves the use of multimedia technology, such as displays and visual content, which can be related to multimedia (cs.MM).
